cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north then north-northwest, forecast to cross Haiti and eastern Cuba, then track through the Bahamas and parallel the Florida Atlantic coast toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near or just offshore of Florida’s east coast (first U.S. encounter)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida Atlantic coast northward to the Carolinas and the Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Outer circulation could bring sustained 25-35 kt winds with occasional gusts to tropical-storm force late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (1–2 ft) possible in Tampa Bay due to prolonged onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in rain bands Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions in the near-shore Gulf waters could disrupt cargo operations.
